How was the first full-colour photograph of Earth captured by NASA
description: NASA's 1967 ATS-3 satellite captured Earth's first true-colour image, revolutionizing weather forecasting and planetary understanding. The vivid global portrait fostered environmental awareness, bridging science and public consciousness, and laid the foundation for modern satellite imaging.

description: Bihar's recent assembly elections saw the NDA achieve a significant win. The coalition's strategy focused on women-centric welfare programs and various giveaways. These initiatives, including cash allowances and grants, resonated strongly with voters, particularly women and first-time voters. This approach proved successful, mirroring similar electoral outcomes in Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra.

title: RCB sale: Why the road ahead is anything but smooth for Diageo India - Explained
description: Diageo India is reviewing its investment in the Royal Challengers Bengaluru franchise amidst a political storm following a tragic stampede in June that claimed 11 lives. The franchise's home ground, the M Chinnaswamy Stadium, is set to be overlooked for the 2026 T20 World Cup - just like it was for the Maharaja Trophy and the Women's ODI World Cup.

description: Lalu Prasad Yadav's influence persists in Bihar politics, even without his participation in the 2025 elections. His legacy, marked by both 'jungle raj' criticism and support for marginalized communities, continues to shape electoral strategies. Both ruling and opposition alliances invoke his name, highlighting his enduring relevance. Lalu remains a central figure in Bihar's political discourse.

description: Prashant Kishor's ambitious Jan Suraaj party faced a significant setback in the Bihar elections. Despite meticulous planning and a nationwide padyatra, the party struggled to connect with voters on the ground. A lack of local leadership and candidate recognition proved to be major hurdles. The party's focus on professional credentials over local roots also impacted its performance.

title: Bumrah fifer puts IND in control; bad light forces early stumps as hosts trail by 122
description: Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling performance, claiming 5 wickets for 27 runs, spearheaded India's dominance on day one of the first Test against South Africa. The visitors were bundled out for 159, and India reached 37/1 at stumps, trailing by 122 runs. KL Rahul and Washington Sundar remain at the crease, poised to build on Bumrah's decisive spell.

description: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) achieved a remarkable comeback in Bihar, nearly doubling its seats to 85 and proving his leadership despite facing numerous challenges.  Focusing on development and women voters, Nitish defied predictions of a decline. However, the BJP's stronger performance within the NDA might complicate his return as Chief Minister, signaling tough negotiations ahead.

This move aligns with the state's ambition to become a major data centre hub, aiming for 6 GW capacity. The agreement also includes a 6 GW solar power project and an integrated food park.

Trends showed the NDA, led by Nitish Kumar and Narendra Modi, dominating the opposition. This election marked a significant test for Nitish Kumar, with high voter turnout and a historic lack of violence.

description: Congress candidate V. Naveen Yadav secured a decisive victory in the Jubilee Hills Assembly by-poll. He defeated BRS contender Maganti Sunitha Gopinath by a margin of approximately 24,658 votes. This win strengthens Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy's leadership and consolidates Congress's position in Hyderabad. The BRS faces challenges after this outcome. Muslim voters played a crucial role in the election.

title: Women, welfare and the ‘phoenix’ CM: How Nitish-led NDA crushed MGB in Bihar - takeaways
description: Bihar's 2025 assembly election saw the NDA secure a decisive mandate, driven by women-centric welfare, caste recalibration, and strong organization. Nitish Kumar's leadership, PM Modi's appeal, and Chirag Paswan's performance were key factors. The results highlight the enduring impact of welfare schemes and women voters, while exposing the limitations of new political entrants and the INDIA bloc's disarray.

description: Folk singer Maithili Thakur has achieved a historic victory for the BJP in Bihar's Alinagar constituency, marking the party's first win from the seat. The 25-year-old singer, known for her traditional folk performances and strong social media presence, defeated RJD's Binod Mishra, potentially becoming the state's youngest MLA.

title: 63% of Indian Managers say AI training will be core team responsibility within five years
description: India’s leading companies are rapidly integrating artificial intelligence to transform the workplace. According to Microsoft’s 2025 Work Trend Index—India, 93% of leaders plan to use AI agents within 12–18 months to enhance productivity and workforce capacity. Frontier firms are redesigning operations around human-agent collaboration, prioritizing upskilling, agility, and innovation to shape India’s AI-powered future of work.

title: Bihar election results: Top winners and losers
description: Bihar's 2025 election sees the NDA secure a decisive victory, with Nitish Kumar and PM Modi emerging as key winners. Women voters played a pivotal role, driving turnout and influencing the mandate. Conversely, Tejashwi Yadav faced a significant setback, failing to convert momentum into votes, while Rahul Gandhi and Prashant Kishor also experienced disappointing results.

Known for her grace and talent, she delivered memorable performances in numerous films, leaving an indelible mark on Indian cinema.

description: General Motors is directing thousands of suppliers to remove China-sourced parts and raw materials from their supply chains, aiming for complete divestment by 2027. This move, intensified by deepening U.S.-China trade hostilities and President Trump's policies, seeks to enhance supply chain resiliency. Carmakers are accelerating efforts to unwind decades-old sourcing ties due to ongoing geopolitical and economic wrangling.
